Windows 11/10 Manual IP Address Change
- Make sure you’re signed in with your administrator account.
- Open Control Panel.
- Click on “Network and Internet.”
- Select “Network and Sharing Center.”
- On the left side, locate “Change Adapter Settings” and select it.
- In the new window, find your connection and right-click on it.
- Select “Properties.”
- Find “Internet Protocol 4 (TCP/IPv4)” or “Internet Protocol 6 (TCP/IPv6)” depending on which type of IP address you’re using.
- Select the appropriate option and click “Properties.”
- Tick the box next to “Use the Following IP Address.”
- Enter the desired IP address and press OK.
macOS Manual IP Address Change
- Open “System Settings” and select “Network.”
- Click on “Wi-Fi” and then press “Details…”
- From here, click on “TCP/IP” on the left side.
- On the right, you’ll see “Configure IPv4” or “Configure IPv6.” Select one based on your IP type and make sure it’s set to “Manually.”
- Next to “IPv4 Address” or “IPv6 Address”, type in the new IP you want to use and click OK.

- Open Settings.
- Find your WiFi settings – it’s titled “Connections” on Samsung. Tap on it.
- Select your WiFi network and open its settings.
- Open advanced WiFi settings for that network. On Samsung, it’s the “View More” button that opens additional options.
- Under “IP Settings”, select “Static” instead of “DHCP.”
- Now enter your IP address and press Save.
Change Your IP address Manually on iOS (iPhone and iPad)
- Open Settings.
- Select “Wi-Fi” and tap on the network you’re using.
- Find the “IPv4 Address” menu and select “Configure IP.”
- Tap on “Manual” and enter the new IP address.
- Press Save and you’re done.
